Platform.Title: SMD Print_745 Mycobacterium tuberculosis
Platform.Manufacturer: Stanford Functional Genomics Facility, Stanford School of Medicine
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: Material is transferred from microtiter plate wells to the slide surface by an automated print head

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: ORF Name

Sample.Title: H37Rv wild type control vs 5mM Diamide for 60 min rep 4

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv wild type; Treatment: Control
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Parameter Time = 60 min; Parameter Compound Based Treatment = "Control, no treatment "; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: TB-Synthesis and Labeling of cDNA SKlab 01; 1. Bring 0.5-5 ug RNA (Typically 3 ug) to 11 ul and add 2 ul (~2 mg/ml) random hexamers. 2. Heat 10 min at 65C (or 2 min at 98C), snap cool on ice. 10 rxns 20 rxns 3. Add 11ul 5.0 ul 5X First-Strand buffer (51) (102) 2.5 ul 100 mM DTT (25.5) (51) 2.0 ul dNTP (5 mM A,G,C and 0.2 mM T) (20.5) (41) 1.5 ul Cy3 or Cy5 (Typically use Cy5 for sample that should change) (15.3) (30.6) Then add 1.2-1.8 ul Stratascript or 0.8-1.2 ul Superscript II RTase. 4. Incubate 10m at 25C followed by 90m at 42C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4C o/n.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv wild type; Treatment: 5mM Diamide for 60 min
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: TB-Slide Preparation SKlab 01; 1. Prepare NaOH-ethanol solution ? dissolve NaOH in ddH2O 70 g / 280 mL 175 g / 700mL 200 g / 800 mL ? stir until completely dissolved ? add 95% ethanol 420 mL 1050 mL 1200mL ? stir until completely mixed ? if solution remains cloudy, add water until clear 2. Place slides in metal slide racks (30 slides/rack). Do not use defective slides. 3. Soak slides in the NaOH:EtOH:ddH2O solution for 2 hours with gentle rotation. 4. Rinse extensively with dH2O: ? rinse each unit (slide/rack/container) vigorously with dH2O for 5 min ? place slide racks in a large clean glass container, and tilt the container slightly for constant water flow. ? wash under running water for 30 minutes. ? do not allow the slides to dry at any time. It is critical to remove all traces of NaOH:EtOH. 5. Prepare poly-L-lysine solution in plastic container. ? 100 mL tissue culture PBS 800 mL Milli-Q water 100 mL poly-L-Lysine ? We bring up the volume to about 1050 mL with Milli-Q water in order to submerge 3 racks of slides. ? Mix well and split into 3 plastic containers. 6. Soak the slides in lysine solution for 45 min with shaking. Be sure to use a plastic container, because poly-L-lysine adheres to glass. Poly-L-Lysine solution may be reused. Keep the other slide filled racks in dH2O, while the first 3 are being coated. 7. After the lysine coating, rinse the slides by gently plunging up and down in 2 different changes of water. Spin dry 5' at 600 rpm. Place paper towels below rack to absorb liquid. 8. Store slides in a dessicator for 3 weeks prior to use. Slides that are older than 3 months may result in faint printing and higher background. Be sure to clean racks and containers thoroughly after each use. Built-up poly-L-Lysine on the sides of the containers may cause problems.; Protocol Type = Treatment; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Parameter Starting OD = 0.2; Parameter Elapsed Time = 60 min; Parameter Culture Volume = 40 ml; Parameter Growth Temperature = 37oC; Parameter Culture Synchrony = Unsynchronized; Parameter Media = Middlebrook 7H9 supplemented with albumin-dextrose complex (ADC) and 0.01% Tween 80
Channel.Extract-Protocol: TB-RNA Isolation and Purification SKlab 01; 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.1-0.2) 4 min at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ?80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Gibco-BRL) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing,while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.4 ml glass beads in a 2 ml screw cap tube. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample.Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5 min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 45s at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 ml screw cap tube containing half of the Heavy Phase Lock Gel I, supplied by 5 Prime 3 Prime, Inc. in 1.5 ml tubes and transferred with sterile stick to 2 ml tubes, and 300 ul Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1). Invert rapidly for 15s, and continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10m, remove aqueous layer (540 ul) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270 ul isopropanol then add 270 ul high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically ppted at 4C O/N. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5m. 7. Remove EtOH by aspiration. Then, dry under vacuum for 2 min [Do not over dry]. 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ml RNase free water (don?t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration) 9. Add 10 ul 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ug RNA) and add 4 ul DNaseI (Ambion). Incubate 30m at 37C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350 ul RLT buffer (add 10 ul BME to 1 ml RLT before using) and vortex. Add 260 ul 95% EtOH (or 250 ul 100% EtOH) to each sample and vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500 ul RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500 ul additional RPE and centrifuge 2m. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1m to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40 ul RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1 ul in 199 ul TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 ug/A260x A260 = ug/ml]. 5. Run 1 ul RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200ul. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer. bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Parameter Amount of extract labeled = 3ug of total RNA; Parameter Type of label = Cy5; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Name: ID_REF
Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500 ul RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500 ul additional RPE and centrifuge 2m. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1m to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40 ul RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1 ul in 199 ul TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 ug/A260x A260 = ug/ml]. 5. Run 1 ul RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200ul. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer. bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Parameter Amount of extract labeled = 3ug of total RNA; Parameter Type of label = Cy5; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT

Column.Name: LEFT

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: H37Rv wild type vs H37Rv sigB null mutant rep 1

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv wild type; Treatment: No Treatment
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Parameter Time = 60 min; Parameter Compound Based Treatment = "Control, no treatment "; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: TB-Synthesis and Labeling of cDNA SKlab 01; 1. Bring 0.5-5 ug RNA (Typically 3 ug) to 11 ul and add 2 ul (~2 mg/ml) random hexamers. 2. Heat 10 min at 65C (or 2 min at 98C), snap cool on ice. 10 rxns 20 rxns 3. Add 11ul 5.0 ul 5X First-Strand buffer (51) (102) 2.5 ul 100 mM DTT (25.5) (51) 2.0 ul dNTP (5 mM A,G,C and 0.2 mM T) (20.5) (41) 1.5 ul Cy3 or Cy5 (Typically use Cy5 for sample that should change) (15.3) (30.6) Then add 1.2-1.8 ul Stratascript or 0.8-1.2 ul Superscript II RTase. 4. Incubate 10m at 25C followed by 90m at 42C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4C o/n.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv sigB null mutant; Treatment: No Treatment
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: TB-Slide Preparation SKlab 01; 1. Prepare NaOH-ethanol solution ? dissolve NaOH in ddH2O 70 g / 280 mL 175 g / 700mL 200 g / 800 mL ? stir until completely dissolved ? add 95% ethanol 420 mL 1050 mL 1200mL ? stir until completely mixed ? if solution remains cloudy, add water until clear 2. Place slides in metal slide racks (30 slides/rack). Do not use defective slides. 3. Soak slides in the NaOH:EtOH:ddH2O solution for 2 hours with gentle rotation. 4. Rinse extensively with dH2O: ? rinse each unit (slide/rack/container) vigorously with dH2O for 5 min ? place slide racks in a large clean glass container, and tilt the container slightly for constant water flow. ? wash under running water for 30 minutes. ? do not allow the slides to dry at any time. It is critical to remove all traces of NaOH:EtOH. 5. Prepare poly-L-lysine solution in plastic container. ? 100 mL tissue culture PBS 800 mL Milli-Q water 100 mL poly-L-Lysine ? We bring up the volume to about 1050 mL with Milli-Q water in order to submerge 3 racks of slides. ? Mix well and split into 3 plastic containers. 6. Soak the slides in lysine solution for 45 min with shaking. Be sure to use a plastic container, because poly-L-lysine adheres to glass. Poly-L-Lysine solution may be reused. Keep the other slide filled racks in dH2O, while the first 3 are being coated. 7. After the lysine coating, rinse the slides by gently plunging up and down in 2 different changes of water. Spin dry 5' at 600 rpm. Place paper towels below rack to absorb liquid. 8. Store slides in a dessicator for 3 weeks prior to use. Slides that are older than 3 months may result in faint printing and higher background. Be sure to clean racks and containers thoroughly after each use. Built-up poly-L-Lysine on the sides of the containers may cause problems.; Protocol Type = Treatment; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Parameter Starting OD = 0.2; Parameter Elapsed Time = 60 min; Parameter Culture Volume = 40 ml; Parameter Growth Temperature = 37oC; Parameter Culture Synchrony = Unsynchronized; Parameter Media = Middlebrook 7H9 supplemented with albumin-dextrose complex (ADC) and 0.01% Tween 80
Channel.Extract-Protocol: TB-RNA Isolation and Purification SKlab 01; 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.1-0.2) 4 min at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ?80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Gibco-BRL) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing,while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.4 ml glass beads in a 2 ml screw cap tube. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample.Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5 min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 45s at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 ml screw cap tube containing half of the Heavy Phase Lock Gel I, supplied by 5 Prime 3 Prime, Inc. in 1.5 ml tubes and transferred with sterile stick to 2 ml tubes, and 300 ul Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1). Invert rapidly for 15s, and continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10m, remove aqueous layer (540 ul) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270 ul isopropanol then add 270 ul high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically ppted at 4C O/N. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5m. 7. Remove EtOH by aspiration. Then, dry under vacuum for 2 min [Do not over dry]. 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ml RNase free water (don?t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration) 9. Add 10 ul 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ug RNA) and add 4 ul DNaseI (Ambion). Incubate 30m at 37C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350 ul RLT buffer (add 10 ul BME to 1 ml RLT before using) and vortex. Add 260 ul 95% EtOH (or 250 ul 100% EtOH) to each sample and vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500 ul RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500 ul additional RPE and centrifuge 2m. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1m to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40 ul RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1 ul in 199 ul TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 ug/A260x A260 = ug/ml]. 5. Run 1 ul RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200ul. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer. bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Channel.Label-Protocol: Parameter Amount of extract labeled = 3ug of total RNA; Parameter Type of label = Cy5; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: H37Rv sigB null mutant control vs 0.05% SDS for 60 min rep 4

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv sigB null mutant; Treatment: Control
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Parameter Time = 60 min; Parameter Compound Based Treatment = "Control, no treatment "; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: TB-Synthesis and Labeling of cDNA SKlab 01; 1. Bring 0.5-5 ug RNA (Typically 3 ug) to 11 ul and add 2 ul (~2 mg/ml) random hexamers. 2. Heat 10 min at 65C (or 2 min at 98C), snap cool on ice. 10 rxns 20 rxns 3. Add 11ul 5.0 ul 5X First-Strand buffer (51) (102) 2.5 ul 100 mM DTT (25.5) (51) 2.0 ul dNTP (5 mM A,G,C and 0.2 mM T) (20.5) (41) 1.5 ul Cy3 or Cy5 (Typically use Cy5 for sample that should change) (15.3) (30.6) Then add 1.2-1.8 ul Stratascript or 0.8-1.2 ul Superscript II RTase. 4. Incubate 10m at 25C followed by 90m at 42C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4C o/n.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv sigB null mutant; Treatment: 0.05% SDS for 60 min
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: TB-Slide Preparation SKlab 01; 1. Prepare NaOH-ethanol solution ? dissolve NaOH in ddH2O 70 g / 280 mL 175 g / 700mL 200 g / 800 mL ? stir until completely dissolved ? add 95% ethanol 420 mL 1050 mL 1200mL ? stir until completely mixed ? if solution remains cloudy, add water until clear 2. Place slides in metal slide racks (30 slides/rack). Do not use defective slides. 3. Soak slides in the NaOH:EtOH:ddH2O solution for 2 hours with gentle rotation. 4. Rinse extensively with dH2O: ? rinse each unit (slide/rack/container) vigorously with dH2O for 5 min ? place slide racks in a large clean glass container, and tilt the container slightly for constant water flow. ? wash under running water for 30 minutes. ? do not allow the slides to dry at any time. It is critical to remove all traces of NaOH:EtOH. 5. Prepare poly-L-lysine solution in plastic container. ? 100 mL tissue culture PBS 800 mL Milli-Q water 100 mL poly-L-Lysine ? We bring up the volume to about 1050 mL with Milli-Q water in order to submerge 3 racks of slides. ? Mix well and split into 3 plastic containers. 6. Soak the slides in lysine solution for 45 min with shaking. Be sure to use a plastic container, because poly-L-lysine adheres to glass. Poly-L-Lysine solution may be reused. Keep the other slide filled racks in dH2O, while the first 3 are being coated. 7. After the lysine coating, rinse the slides by gently plunging up and down in 2 different changes of water. Spin dry 5' at 600 rpm. Place paper towels below rack to absorb liquid. 8. Store slides in a dessicator for 3 weeks prior to use. Slides that are older than 3 months may result in faint printing and higher background. Be sure to clean racks and containers thoroughly after each use. Built-up poly-L-Lysine on the sides of the containers may cause problems.; Protocol Type = Treatment; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Parameter Starting OD = 0.2; Parameter Elapsed Time = 60 min; Parameter Culture Volume = 40 ml; Parameter Growth Temperature = 37oC; Parameter Culture Synchrony = Unsynchronized; Parameter Media = Middlebrook 7H9 supplemented with albumin-dextrose complex (ADC) and 0.01% Tween 80
Channel.Extract-Protocol: TB-RNA Isolation and Purification SKlab 01; 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.1-0.2) 4 min at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ?80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Gibco-BRL) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing,while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.4 ml glass beads in a 2 ml screw cap tube. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample.Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5 min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 45s at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 ml screw cap tube containing half of the Heavy Phase Lock Gel I, supplied by 5 Prime 3 Prime, Inc. in 1.5 ml tubes and transferred with sterile stick to 2 ml tubes, and 300 ul Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1). Invert rapidly for 15s, and continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10m, remove aqueous layer (540 ul) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270 ul isopropanol then add 270 ul high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically ppted at 4C O/N. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5m. 7. Remove EtOH by aspiration. Then, dry under vacuum for 2 min [Do not over dry]. 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ml RNase free water (don?t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration) 9. Add 10 ul 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ug RNA) and add 4 ul DNaseI (Ambion). Incubate 30m at 37C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350 ul RLT buffer (add 10 ul BME to 1 ml RLT before using) and vortex. Add 260 ul 95% EtOH (or 250 ul 100% EtOH) to each sample and vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500 ul RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500 ul additional RPE and centrifuge 2m. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1m to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40 ul RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1 ul in 199 ul TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 ug/A260x A260 = ug/ml]. 5. Run 1 ul RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200ul. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer. bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Parameter Amount of extract labeled = 3ug of total RNA; Parameter Type of label = Cy5; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Name: ID_REF
Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5m. 7. Remove EtOH by aspiration. Then, dry under vacuum for 2 min [Do not over dry]. 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ml RNase free water (don?t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration) 9. Add 10 ul 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ug RNA) and add 4 ul DNaseI (Ambion). Incubate 30m at 37C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350 ul RLT buffer (add 10 ul BME to 1 ml RLT before using) and vortex. Add 260 ul 95% EtOH (or 250 ul 100% EtOH) to each sample and vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500 ul RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500 ul additional RPE and centrifuge 2m. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1m to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40 ul RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1 ul in 199 ul TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 ug/A260x A260 = ug/ml]. 5. Run 1 ul RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200ul. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer. bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Parameter Amount of extract labeled = 3ug of total RNA; Parameter Type of label = Cy5; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Name: ID_REF
Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: H37Rv wild type vs H37Rv sigB null mutant rep 5

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv wild type; Treatment: No Treatment
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Parameter Time = 60 min; Parameter Compound Based Treatment = "Control, no treatment "; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: TB-Synthesis and Labeling of cDNA SKlab 01; 1. Bring 0.5-5 ug RNA (Typically 3 ug) to 11 ul and add 2 ul (~2 mg/ml) random hexamers. 2. Heat 10 min at 65C (or 2 min at 98C), snap cool on ice. 10 rxns 20 rxns 3. Add 11ul 5.0 ul 5X First-Strand buffer (51) (102) 2.5 ul 100 mM DTT (25.5) (51) 2.0 ul dNTP (5 mM A,G,C and 0.2 mM T) (20.5) (41) 1.5 ul Cy3 or Cy5 (Typically use Cy5 for sample that should change) (15.3) (30.6) Then add 1.2-1.8 ul Stratascript or 0.8-1.2 ul Superscript II RTase. 4. Incubate 10m at 25C followed by 90m at 42C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4C o/n.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv sigB null mutant; Treatment: No Treatment
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: TB-Slide Preparation SKlab 01; 1. Prepare NaOH-ethanol solution ? dissolve NaOH in ddH2O 70 g / 280 mL 175 g / 700mL 200 g / 800 mL ? stir until completely dissolved ? add 95% ethanol 420 mL 1050 mL 1200mL ? stir until completely mixed ? if solution remains cloudy, add water until clear 2. Place slides in metal slide racks (30 slides/rack). Do not use defective slides. 3. Soak slides in the NaOH:EtOH:ddH2O solution for 2 hours with gentle rotation. 4. Rinse extensively with dH2O: ? rinse each unit (slide/rack/container) vigorously with dH2O for 5 min ? place slide racks in a large clean glass container, and tilt the container slightly for constant water flow. ? wash under running water for 30 minutes. ? do not allow the slides to dry at any time. It is critical to remove all traces of NaOH:EtOH. 5. Prepare poly-L-lysine solution in plastic container. ? 100 mL tissue culture PBS 800 mL Milli-Q water 100 mL poly-L-Lysine ? We bring up the volume to about 1050 mL with Milli-Q water in order to submerge 3 racks of slides. ? Mix well and split into 3 plastic containers. 6. Soak the slides in lysine solution for 45 min with shaking. Be sure to use a plastic container, because poly-L-lysine adheres to glass. Poly-L-Lysine solution may be reused. Keep the other slide filled racks in dH2O, while the first 3 are being coated. 7. After the lysine coating, rinse the slides by gently plunging up and down in 2 different changes of water. Spin dry 5' at 600 rpm. Place paper towels below rack to absorb liquid. 8. Store slides in a dessicator for 3 weeks prior to use. Slides that are older than 3 months may result in faint printing and higher background. Be sure to clean racks and containers thoroughly after each use. Built-up poly-L-Lysine on the sides of the containers may cause problems.; Protocol Type = Treatment; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Parameter Starting OD = 0.2; Parameter Elapsed Time = 60 min; Parameter Culture Volume = 40 ml; Parameter Growth Temperature = 37oC; Parameter Culture Synchrony = Unsynchronized; Parameter Media = Middlebrook 7H9 supplemented with albumin-dextrose complex (ADC) and 0.01% Tween 80
Channel.Extract-Protocol: TB-RNA Isolation and Purification SKlab 01; 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.1-0.2) 4 min at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ?80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Gibco-BRL) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing,while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.4 ml glass beads in a 2 ml screw cap tube. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample.Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5 min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 45s at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 ml screw cap tube containing half of the Heavy Phase Lock Gel I, supplied by 5 Prime 3 Prime, Inc. in 1.5 ml tubes and transferred with sterile stick to 2 ml tubes, and 300 ul Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1). Invert rapidly for 15s, and continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10m, remove aqueous layer (540 ul) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270 ul isopropanol then add 270 ul high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically ppted at 4C O/N. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5m. 7. Remove EtOH by aspiration. Then, dry under vacuum for 2 min [Do not over dry]. 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ml RNase free water (don?t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration) 9. Add 10 ul 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ug RNA) and add 4 ul DNaseI (Ambion). Incubate 30m at 37C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350 ul RLT buffer (add 10 ul BME to 1 ml RLT before using) and vortex. Add 260 ul 95% EtOH (or 250 ul 100% EtOH) to each sample and vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500 ul RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500 ul additional RPE and centrifuge 2m. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1m to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40 ul RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1 ul in 199 ul TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 ug/A260x A260 = ug/ml]. 5. Run 1 ul RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200ul. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer. bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: H37Rv wild type Vs H37Rv wild type rep 4

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv wild type; Treatment: No Treatment
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Parameter Time = 60 min; Parameter Compound Based Treatment = "Control, no treatment "; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: TB-Synthesis and Labeling of cDNA SKlab 01; 1. Bring 0.5-5 ug RNA (Typically 3 ug) to 11 ul and add 2 ul (~2 mg/ml) random hexamers. 2. Heat 10 min at 65C (or 2 min at 98C), snap cool on ice. 10 rxns 20 rxns 3. Add 11ul 5.0 ul 5X First-Strand buffer (51) (102) 2.5 ul 100 mM DTT (25.5) (51) 2.0 ul dNTP (5 mM A,G,C and 0.2 mM T) (20.5) (41) 1.5 ul Cy3 or Cy5 (Typically use Cy5 for sample that should change) (15.3) (30.6) Then add 1.2-1.8 ul Stratascript or 0.8-1.2 ul Superscript II RTase. 4. Incubate 10m at 25C followed by 90m at 42C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4C o/n.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv wild type; Treatment: No Treatment
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: TB-Slide Preparation SKlab 01; 1. Prepare NaOH-ethanol solution ? dissolve NaOH in ddH2O 70 g / 280 mL 175 g / 700mL 200 g / 800 mL ? stir until completely dissolved ? add 95% ethanol 420 mL 1050 mL 1200mL ? stir until completely mixed ? if solution remains cloudy, add water until clear 2. Place slides in metal slide racks (30 slides/rack). Do not use defective slides. 3. Soak slides in the NaOH:EtOH:ddH2O solution for 2 hours with gentle rotation. 4. Rinse extensively with dH2O: ? rinse each unit (slide/rack/container) vigorously with dH2O for 5 min ? place slide racks in a large clean glass container, and tilt the container slightly for constant water flow. ? wash under running water for 30 minutes. ? do not allow the slides to dry at any time. It is critical to remove all traces of NaOH:EtOH. 5. Prepare poly-L-lysine solution in plastic container. ? 100 mL tissue culture PBS 800 mL Milli-Q water 100 mL poly-L-Lysine ? We bring up the volume to about 1050 mL with Milli-Q water in order to submerge 3 racks of slides. ? Mix well and split into 3 plastic containers. 6. Soak the slides in lysine solution for 45 min with shaking. Be sure to use a plastic container, because poly-L-lysine adheres to glass. Poly-L-Lysine solution may be reused. Keep the other slide filled racks in dH2O, while the first 3 are being coated. 7. After the lysine coating, rinse the slides by gently plunging up and down in 2 different changes of water. Spin dry 5' at 600 rpm. Place paper towels below rack to absorb liquid. 8. Store slides in a dessicator for 3 weeks prior to use. Slides that are older than 3 months may result in faint printing and higher background. Be sure to clean racks and containers thoroughly after each use. Built-up poly-L-Lysine on the sides of the containers may cause problems.; Protocol Type = Treatment; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Parameter Starting OD = 0.2; Parameter Elapsed Time = 60 min; Parameter Culture Volume = 40 ml; Parameter Growth Temperature = 37oC; Parameter Culture Synchrony = Unsynchronized; Parameter Media = Middlebrook 7H9 supplemented with albumin-dextrose complex (ADC) and 0.01% Tween 80
Channel.Extract-Protocol: TB-RNA Isolation and Purification SKlab 01; 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.1-0.2) 4 min at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ?80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Gibco-BRL) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing,while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.4 ml glass beads in a 2 ml screw cap tube. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample.Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5 min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 45s at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 ml screw cap tube containing half of the Heavy Phase Lock Gel I, supplied by 5 Prime 3 Prime, Inc. in 1.5 ml tubes and transferred with sterile stick to 2 ml tubes, and 300 ul Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1). Invert rapidly for 15s, and continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10m, remove aqueous layer (540 ul) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270 ul isopropanol then add 270 ul high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically ppted at 4C O/N. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5m. 7. Remove EtOH by aspiration. Then, dry under vacuum for 2 min [Do not over dry]. 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ml RNase free water (don?t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration) 9. Add 10 ul 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ug RNA) and add 4 ul DNaseI (Ambion). Incubate 30m at 37C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350 ul RLT buffer (add 10 ul BME to 1 ml RLT before using) and vortex. Add 260 ul 95% EtOH (or 250 ul 100% EtOH) to each sample and vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500 ul RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500 ul additional RPE and centrifuge 2m. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1m to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40 ul RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1 ul in 199 ul TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 ug/A260x A260 = ug/ml]. 5. Run 1 ul RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200ul. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer. bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Parameter Amount of extract labeled = 3ug of total RNA; Parameter Type of label = Cy5; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Invert rapidly for 15s, and continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10m, remove aqueous layer (540 ul) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270 ul isopropanol then add 270 ul high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically ppted at 4C O/N. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5m. 7. Remove EtOH by aspiration. Then, dry under vacuum for 2 min [Do not over dry]. 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ml RNase free water (don?t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration) 9. Add 10 ul 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ug RNA) and add 4 ul DNaseI (Ambion). Incubate 30m at 37C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350 ul RLT buffer (add 10 ul BME to 1 ml RLT before using) and vortex. Add 260 ul 95% EtOH (or 250 ul 100% EtOH) to each sample and vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500 ul RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500 ul additional RPE and centrifuge 2m. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1m to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40 ul RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1 ul in 199 ul TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 ug/A260x A260 = ug/ml]. 5. Run 1 ul RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200ul. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer. bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Parameter Amount of extract labeled = 3ug of total RNA; Parameter Type of label = Cy5; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Name: ID_REF
Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: H37Rv wild type control vs 5mM Diamide for 60 min rep 3

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv wild type; Treatment: Control
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Parameter Time = 60 min; Parameter Compound Based Treatment = "Control, no treatment "; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Extract-Protocol: not provided
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: TB-Synthesis and Labeling of cDNA SKlab 01; 1. Bring 0.5-5 ug RNA (Typically 3 ug) to 11 ul and add 2 ul (~2 mg/ml) random hexamers. 2. Heat 10 min at 65C (or 2 min at 98C), snap cool on ice. 10 rxns 20 rxns 3. Add 11ul 5.0 ul 5X First-Strand buffer (51) (102) 2.5 ul 100 mM DTT (25.5) (51) 2.0 ul dNTP (5 mM A,G,C and 0.2 mM T) (20.5) (41) 1.5 ul Cy3 or Cy5 (Typically use Cy5 for sample that should change) (15.3) (30.6) Then add 1.2-1.8 ul Stratascript or 0.8-1.2 ul Superscript II RTase. 4. Incubate 10m at 25C followed by 90m at 42C in PCR machine. Can freeze or leave at 4C o/n.; Protocol Type = Labeling; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil

Channel.Source: Strain: H37Rv wild type; Treatment: 5mM Diamide for 60 min
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: TB-Slide Preparation SKlab 01; 1. Prepare NaOH-ethanol solution ? dissolve NaOH in ddH2O 70 g / 280 mL 175 g / 700mL 200 g / 800 mL ? stir until completely dissolved ? add 95% ethanol 420 mL 1050 mL 1200mL ? stir until completely mixed ? if solution remains cloudy, add water until clear 2. Place slides in metal slide racks (30 slides/rack). Do not use defective slides. 3. Soak slides in the NaOH:EtOH:ddH2O solution for 2 hours with gentle rotation. 4. Rinse extensively with dH2O: ? rinse each unit (slide/rack/container) vigorously with dH2O for 5 min ? place slide racks in a large clean glass container, and tilt the container slightly for constant water flow. ? wash under running water for 30 minutes. ? do not allow the slides to dry at any time. It is critical to remove all traces of NaOH:EtOH. 5. Prepare poly-L-lysine solution in plastic container. ? 100 mL tissue culture PBS 800 mL Milli-Q water 100 mL poly-L-Lysine ? We bring up the volume to about 1050 mL with Milli-Q water in order to submerge 3 racks of slides. ? Mix well and split into 3 plastic containers. 6. Soak the slides in lysine solution for 45 min with shaking. Be sure to use a plastic container, because poly-L-lysine adheres to glass. Poly-L-Lysine solution may be reused. Keep the other slide filled racks in dH2O, while the first 3 are being coated. 7. After the lysine coating, rinse the slides by gently plunging up and down in 2 different changes of water. Spin dry 5' at 600 rpm. Place paper towels below rack to absorb liquid. 8. Store slides in a dessicator for 3 weeks prior to use. Slides that are older than 3 months may result in faint printing and higher background. Be sure to clean racks and containers thoroughly after each use. Built-up poly-L-Lysine on the sides of the containers may cause problems.; Protocol Type = Treatment; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Parameter Starting OD = 0.2; Parameter Elapsed Time = 60 min; Parameter Culture Volume = 40 ml; Parameter Growth Temperature = 37oC; Parameter Culture Synchrony = Unsynchronized; Parameter Media = Middlebrook 7H9 supplemented with albumin-dextrose complex (ADC) and 0.01% Tween 80
Channel.Extract-Protocol: TB-RNA Isolation and Purification SKlab 01; 1. Centrifuge 20-30 ml of early- to mid-log culture (O.D. 0.1-0.2) 4 min at 3700 rpm, at RT-37C. Pipette off supernatant and immediately freeze on dry ice and store at ?80C. 2. Add 1 ml Trizol (Gibco-BRL) to each of 4-8 pellets, suspend first pellet by vortexing,while other pellets are still frozen. Add suspension to 0.4 ml glass beads in a 2 ml screw cap tube. 3. Shake 30s at maximum speed in bead beater. Suspend next pellet and add to glass beads. Apply next sample to bead beater. Repeat bead beating two more times with each sample.Continue to periodically invert samples for at least 5 min in Trizol. 4. Centrifuge samples 45s at max speed, remove Trizol solution to a 2 ml screw cap tube containing half of the Heavy Phase Lock Gel I, supplied by 5 Prime 3 Prime, Inc. in 1.5 ml tubes and transferred with sterile stick to 2 ml tubes, and 300 ul Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol (24:1). Invert rapidly for 15s, and continue inverting periodically for 2 min.a 5. Centrifuge 5-10m, remove aqueous layer (540 ul) and add to a 1.5 ml tube containing 270 ul isopropanol then add 270 ul high salt solution (0.8M Na Citrate, 1.2M NaCl). Invert several times and spray with Staphene and remove from the P3. Typically ppted at 4C O/N. 6. Centrifuge 10m at 4C and remove isopropanol. Add 1 ml 75% EtOHb, invert several times and centrifuge 5m. 7. Remove EtOH by aspiration. Then, dry under vacuum for 2 min [Do not over dry]. 8. Suspend RNA in 90 ml RNase free water (don?t suspend in DNaseI buffer), may need to heat 10m at 55-60C to dissolve RNA. (Optional: obtain RNA concentration) 9. Add 10 ul 10X DNaseI buffer to RNA (use no more than 80 ug RNA) and add 4 ul DNaseI (Ambion). Incubate 30m at 37C. Qiagen RNeasy purification. 1. Add 350 ul RLT buffer (add 10 ul BME to 1 ml RLT before using) and vortex. Add 260 ul 95% EtOH (or 250 ul 100% EtOH) to each sample and vortex. 2. Add to RNeasy spin column, centrifuge 15s, transfer column to a new 2 ml collection tube. Add 500 ul RPE, centrifuge 15s, discard flow-through, add 500 ul additional RPE and centrifuge 2m. If column still wet on sides, remove wash solution from tube and spin 1m to dry. 3. Transfer to a 1.5 ml collection tube, elute with 40 ul RNase free water, centrifuge 1m. 4. Determine RNA concentration with A260/A280 readings. Dilute 1 ul in 199 ul TE. [200(dilution factor)x 40 ug/A260x A260 = ug/ml]. 5. Run 1 ul RNA on 2% Agarose TAE gel. Run gel 45m at 100 volts. aIf Phase Lock Gel is not used, decrease Chloroform:isoamyl alcohol to 200ul. The yield will be less. Be careful not to remove any of the interface layer. bUsing 100% EtOH should be avoided in all steps of preparation of RNA intended for array analysis. Instead use 95% EtOH in preparation of solutions. Benzene contamination may fluoresce. cInstead of using the RNeasy purification, the DNaseI can be inactivated at 65-70C for 15m and then EtOH precipitated. The RNeasy purification may not be necessary in all applications. We find the purification gives more consistent results and is less time consuming, compared to precipitation. In addition, other purifications can be used. Note: The RNeasy column will remove much of the small tRNA and degraded RNA.; Protocol Type = Extract preparation; Performer: Martin,,Voskuil
